dublin_core.dcvalue: Low bandwidth Internet based videoconferencing was used to provide physical rehabilitation consultation services for eight community hospitals Videoconferencing and file transmission used a PC and modem A separate telephone line was used for voice Over 21 months 47 physical rehabilitation consultations were completed for communication disorders foot care gait problems orthotics prosthetics arm weakness and wheelchair prescription Consultations were approximately 40 min long Clinician questionnaires were completed by 47 individuals While more than 80 of the questionnaire responses supported the telemedicine approach remote clinicians rated their satisfaction higher than did the specialists Client questionnaires were completed by 24 individuals a response rate of 51 All clients were comfortable with and had confidence in the teleconsultations
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T12:09:23Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2001-05-07
Low-bandwidth, Internet-based videoconferencing for physical rehabilitation consultations.
